titleStmt.title: A vvord in season: or motives to peace, accomodation, and unity, 'twixt Presbyterian and Independent brethren Drawn from necessity of duty, necessity of expediency, and from the possibility of atchieving.
titleStmt.author: Walwyn, William, 1600-1681, attributed name.

publicationStmt.publisher: printed by J. Macock, for Giles Calvert, dwelling at the black Spred-Eagle at the west end of Pauls,

notesStmt.note: Not William Walwyn's "Word in season" (Wing W695A, W695B), with which this title is sometimes confused.
Reproduction of original in the Folger Shakespeare Library.

place.placeName: the black Spred-Eagle at the west end of Pauls
